Article.Abstract: Antibody (Ab) responses to polysaccharides (PS), such as Neisseria meningitidis group C PS (MCPS), are characterized as being thymus independent and are restricted with regard to clonotype and isotype expression. PS conjugated to proteins, e.g., MCPS coupled with tetanus toxoid or the diphtheria toxin derivative CRM197, elicit thymus-dependent responses. The present study developed a surface plasmon resonance approach to evaluate Ab responses to MCPS conjugate vaccines, including either O-acetylated (OAc+) or de-O-acetylated (OAc-) forms of the PS. The results were generally consistent with those obtained by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay and showed that sera from mice immunized with conjugate vaccines contain Abs that bind more effectively to OAc+ and OAc- MCPS than sera from mice immunized with fixed bacteria. The data suggest a critical shared or overlapping epitope recognized by all the conjugate vaccine immune sera and strategies for assessing polyclonal Ab avidity.
Article.ArticleTitle: Surface plasmon resonance analysis of antipolysaccharide antibody specificity: responses to meningococcal group C conjugate vaccines and bacteria.
Article.Affiliations: Division of Monoclonal Antibodies, Office of Biotechnology Products, Center for Drugs Evaluation and Research, Food and Drug Administration, Bethesda, Maryland 20892, USA.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antibodies, Bacterial;Antibodies, Monoclonal;Immunoglobulin G;Immunoglobulin M;Meningococcal Vaccines;Polysaccharides, Bacterial;serogroup C meningococcal conjugate vaccine
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Acetylation; Animals; Antibodies, Bacterial(blood; metabolism); Antibodies, Monoclonal(blood; metabolism); Antibody Affinity; Antibody Specificity; Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay; Female; Immunization; Immunoglobulin G(blood); Immunoglobulin M(blood); Meningococcal Infections(prevention & control); Meningococcal Vaccines(administration & dosage; immunology); Mice; Mice, Inbred BALB C; Neisseria meningitidis(immunology); Polysaccharides, Bacterial(chemistry; immunology); Surface Plasmon Resonance(methods)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The meningococcal group C capsular PS (MCPS) is a linear homopolymer of alpha-(2-9)-linked sialic acid residues that are O-acetylated at carbons 7 and/or 8.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of conjugate, equivalent to 2 ug of MCPS, 4 weeks apart

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunogen is the MCPS conjugated to CRM97 (detoxified Diphteria toxin).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to the epitope (acetylated MCPS) was detected by fluorescence ELISA and by SPR.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of conjugate, equivalent to 2 ug of MCPS, 4 weeks apart

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunogen is the MCPS conjugated to CRM97 (detoxified Diphteria toxin).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to the epitope (acetylated MCPS) was detected by fluorescence ELISA. The IgM response is of similar avidity than in non-immune control mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of conjugate, equivalent to 2 ug of MCPS, 4 weeks apart

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunogen is the MCPS conjugated to CRM97 (detoxified Diphteria toxin).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to the natural, deacetylated MCPS was detected by fluorescence ELISA and by SPR.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of 10 ¬µg conjugate, 8 weeks apart

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunization is described in Garc√≠a-Ojeda et al, Infect Immun. 2000 68:239 [PMID:10603394]. The boost was given i.v. The adjuvant is Maalox (aluminium hydroxide and magnesium hydroxide).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to natural, acetylated MCPS was detected by fluorescence ELISA, Ouchterlony precipitation and SPR. The response to the acetylated MCPS was higher than to the deacetylated MCPS for mAbs C2/1076.10 and C2/256.8, while the opposite is true for mAb C2/655.7.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of conjugate, equivalent to 2 ug of MCPS, 4 weeks apart

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunogen is the MCPS conjugated to CRM97 (detoxified Diphteria toxin).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to the natural, deacetylated MCPS was detected by fluorescence ELISA. The IgM response is of similar avidity than in non-immune control mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of conjugate, equivalent to 2 ug of MCPS, 4 weeks apart

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to the epitope (deacetylated MCPS) was detected by fluorescence ELISA and by SPR.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of conjugate, equivalent to 2 ug of MCPS, 4 weeks apart

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to natural, acetylated MCPS was detected by fluorescence ELISA. The IgM response is of similar avidity than in non-immune control mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 10^8 CFU

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunogen was N. meningitidis serogroup C that either expresses acetylated or deacetylated capsular polysaccharide. No further detail on the strains used is given.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Immunization with bacteria actually depleted the naturally occuring anti-epitope antibodies found in non-immune control mice when tested by fluorescence ELISA. A very low response could be detected by SPR.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 10^8 CFU

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunogen was N. meningitidis serogroup C that either expresses acetylated or deacetylated capsular polysaccharide. No further detail on the strains used is given.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Immunization with bacteria actually depleted the naturally occuring anti-epitope antibodies found in non-immune control mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of conjugate, equivalent to 2 ug of MCPS, 4 weeks apart

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunogen is the MCPS conjugated to CRM97 (detoxified Diphteria toxin).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Binding of the epitope-specific antisera to the epitope by SPR could inihibited by epitope-specific mAbs C2/1076.10 and C2/256.8.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 4 weekly doses of 10^8 CFU of fixed bacteria adn a 5th dose 4 weeks later

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunization is described in Rubinstein and Stein. 1988. J. Immunol. 141:4357 [PMID: 3143763].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to natural, acetylated MCPS was detected by fluorescence ELISA, Ouchterlony precipitation and SPR. The response to the acetylated MCPS was higher than to the deacetylated MCPS for mAb 2055.5, while the opposite is true for mAb 2016.3.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 4 weekly doses of 10^8 CFU of fixed bacteria adn a 5th dose 4 weeks later

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunization is described in Rubinstein and Stein. 1988. J. Immunol. 141:4357 [PMID: 3143763].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to deacetylated MCPS was detected by fluorescence ELISA, Ouchterlony precipitation and SPR. The response to the deacetylated MCPS was lower than to the natural, acetylated MCPS for mAb 2055.5, while the opposite is true for mAb 2016.3.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of 10 ¬µg conjugate, 8 weeks apart

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunization is described in Garc√≠a-Ojeda et al, Infect Immun. 2000 68:239 [PMID:10603394]. The boost was given i.v. The adjuvant is Maalox (aluminium hydroxide and magnesium hydroxide).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to deacetylated MCPS was detected by fluorescence ELISA, Ouchterlony precipitation and SPR. The response to the deacetylated MCPS was lower than to the natural, acetylated MCPS for mAbs C2/1076.10 and C2/256.8, while the opposite is true for mAb C2/655.7.

Epitope.EpitopeName: Deacetylated Meningococcal C polysaccharide repeating unit
Epitope.EpitopeComments: The meningococcal group C capsular PS (MCPS) is a linear homopolymer of alpha-(2-9)-linked sialic acid residues that are O-acetylated at carbons 7 and/or 8. This preparation has been deacetylated, leaving only the sialic acid residues.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 4 weekly doses of 10^8 CFU of fixed bacteria adn a 5th dose 4 weeks later

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunization is described in Rubinstein and Stein. 1988. J. Immunol. 141:4357 [PMID: 3143763].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to natural, acetylated MCPS was detected by fluorescence ELISA, Ouchterlony precipitation and SPR. The response to the acetylated MCPS was higher than to the deacetylated MCPS for mAb 2055.5, while the opposite is true for mAb 2016.3.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of conjugate, equivalent to 2 ug of MCPS, 4 weeks apart

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to the epitope (deacetylated MCPS) was detected by fluorescence ELISA and by SPR.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of 10 ¬µg conjugate, 8 weeks apart

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The immunization is described in Garc√≠a-Ojeda et al, Infect Immun. 2000 68:239 [PMID:10603394]. The boost was given i.v. The adjuvant is Maalox (aluminium hydroxide and magnesium hydroxide).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The response to natural, acetylated MCPS was detected by fluorescence ELISA, Ouchterlony precipitation and SPR. The response to the acetylated MCPS was higher than to the deacetylated MCPS for mAbs C2/1076.10 and C2/256.8, while the opposite is true for mAb C2/655.7.
